required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 02, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Survey of Psychological Status of Medical Workers and Residents in the Context of 2019 Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: A Survey of Psychological Status of Medical Workers and Residents in the Context of 2019 Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia in Wuhan, China

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
Due to the outbreak of 2019 Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia in Wuhan, Hubei province, medical
      staff and residents are facing great psychological pressure, the investigator plan to use
      electronic questionnaire to carry out investigation research.

detailed_description.textblock:
From December 2019, 12 cases of new coronavirus pneumonia broke out in Wuhan, and then the
      epidemic spread rapidly. Till February 1, 2020, there were 14446 confirmed cases in China,
      19544 suspected cases, and 304 deaths. There were confirmed cases reported in 34 provincial
      administrative regions in China; 23 foreign countries reported new coronavirus pneumonia
      cases, 147 confirmed cases. In the face of the rapid spread of the epidemic, people's panic
      and anxiety have seriously affected the prevention and control of the epidemic. In the face
      of the occupational exposure risk and treatment brought by the sudden outbreak of the
      epidemic, the change of mental state of medical staff may affect the prevention and control
      of the epidemic. In order to help the epidemic prevention and control, the investigator plan
      to carry out investigation research.

primary_outcome.description: GHQ-12(general health questionnaire-12): minimal score 0, maximal score 12, higher scores mean a better or worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: IES-R(Impact of Event Scale-Revised):score range:0-88, the higher the worse

arm_group.description:
Voluntary residents
Can use mobile phone or computer

Voluntary residents
Can use mobile phone or computer

study_pop.textblock: medical staff and residents of China who is volunteer to take part in the investigation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  can use mobil phone or computer

          -  volunteer to take part in the investigation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  can not use phone or computer

          -  unwilling to take part in the investigation

facility.name: Tongji Hospital，Tongji Medical College Affiliated，Huazhong University of Science ＆ Technology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
